file_content.text: Yes?
Glad to see you back in one piece. Lost contact shortly after the madness began.
Good to see you all made it back. Lost contact not long after that nightmare began.
Never dreamed the Dread Masters would turn up on Darvannis. No doubt had their eyes on all the weapons and manpower assembled there.
We're just lucky you were there to stop them. If they'd made off with all those mercenaries....
It's time we brought the fight to the Dread Masters.
We can't let this stand.
Agreed. The Empire can no longer afford to ignore the threat those monsters present.
I assume the Empire won't take this lying down?
What's our next move?
Of course not. An incident like this demands immediate retaliation.
The Dread Masters won't be salvaging anything from Darvannis.
Don't worry. We won.
A notable victory. Hopefully not our last.
I'll inform the Minister of War personally and submit a full report to the rest of the Dark Council.
I'll inform the Minister of War personally and submit a full report to the Dark Council.
Hey, what about me? I did my part. You gonna let me go now?
Ah, yes, the Kaleesh. I did promise him his freedom, though I'd be perfectly happy to grant him a criminal's death. What do you think?
We don't need him anymore. Do what you like.
Go ahead and kill him.
You double-crossing--!
Yes, yes, life is so unfair. Take him away.
He held up his end of the bargain. Send him on his way.
Let him go.
You heard him, pirate. Get off my ship.
You heard her, pirate. Get off my ship.
Thanks for the meal, Orlec. Always a pleasure.
As for you, the Empire is indebted. No doubt we'll need your strength in the battles to come.
Your transport is waiting. Good luck.
Mmm! This Dathomiri boar meat is phenomenal! You've got to try a bite, Orlec.
Address me as a familiar again, pirate, and I will personally throw you out the air lock.
My lord, welcome. Not every day the Emperor's Wrath graces my vessel. A rare honor.
My lord, this is a rare honor. Can't remember the last time a member of the Dark Council was aboard my ship.
Don't worry, hunter, I won't give you the same treatment. Though I expect you'll keep your weapons holstered while you're aboard my ship.
Ah, welcome. It's a privilege to be standing before the Empire's most dangerous asset.
Ah, do come in. I've been expecting you.
Moff Orlec. I bring the Emperor's law to our outlying systems, though lately, I've had to fortify our borders against Hutt aggression.
You're a long way from your post. What brings you to the fleet?
I take it you're on leave.
Duty. Always good to be back in the heart of the Empire.
I didn't realize the Hutts were openly opposing the Empire.
Hutt aggression?
I fear it may lead to that.
Is this a guest of yours?
Who's the Kaleesh?
Him? Hardly.
Caught this lowlife piloting a freighter loaded with ordnance toward Hutt Space. A guaranteed pardon and a private meal got him talking.
He claims he was delivering the weapons to a planet called Darvannis. Says the Hutts are building an army there.
It was only a matter of time before the Cartel made its next move.
They never learn.
Do you think the Hutts are preparing to attack the Empire?
Should we be worried?
They've invaded Imperial territory before. Can't rule it out.
That's a bold claim. Can we confirm this?
He could be bluffing.
We have noticed increased traffic into Hutt Space.
If the Kaleesh's intel is accurate, the Hutts are hosting a massive arms bazaar on Darvannis.
Oh, it's accurate. Cartel brought in every hired gun, beast wrangler and arms dealer between here and Coruscant.
Word is the Hutts are buying up all the firepower and muscle they can get their hands on. Been recruiting mercs by the thousands.
A coalition of bandits and thieves are no threat to the Empire.
Hardly worth worrying about.
My lord, some of the galaxy's most notorious mercenary armies are there.
Sounds like the Hutts are positioning themselves to become a galactic superpower.
The Cartel is getting bold.
Not on my watch.
Wonder if they've got room for one more.
Sounds like a sweet gig.
I'm going to pretend I didn't hear that.
Bring the Imperial fleet to Darvannis. We'll wipe them out from orbit.
We've got ships. Use them.
Can't. Planet is surrounded by an asteroid field. Good luck getting one of these flying banthas through that mess.
What kind of scum are we dealing with here?
Any details on these mercs?
The kind crazy enough to attack Dromund Kaas itself if the Hutts paid them enough.
Maybe these mercenaries would be willing to work for the Empire instead.
Can't you outbid the Hutts?
Too costly. Besides, I want these criminals terminated, not promoted.
The Hutts are prohibited from engaging in any military activity on their core worlds. If they're mobilizing for war, the Empire must respond.
I've already organized a mission to wipe out the Cartel's mercenary forces, but such an assault will require the Empire's very best.
I'm not about to let anything threaten the Empire.
You can count on me.
Excellent.
I hope you're prepared to offer me more credits than the Hutts.
I expect hazard pay.
Of course. The Empire is grateful for your loyalty.
What do we do once we're planetside?
Give me the mission details.
Things could get ugly if those mercenaries are expecting us.
This better not be a trap.
Which is why we've taken every precaution to ensure your arrival goes undetected.
Your objective is simple: Infiltrate the biggest display of underworld power the galaxy has seen, and destroy everything in sight.
I'll have a shuttle standing by to take you to Darvannis. Good hunting.
